intro: Melanthera albinervia subsp. caudata, commonly known as the slender whitebeard sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist to saturated soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its subspecies status highlights subtle morphological differences from the main species, particularly in stem structure and leaf characteristics.
